Class Game

java.lang.Object
Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
Define game class to manage all interactions

  • Method Details

    • startGameLoop

      public void startGameLoop()
      Start execution loop

    • heroRound

      private void heroRound() throws HeroDiedException, MonstersDiedException, FinishGameException
      Execute hero functions
      Throws:
      HeroDiedException - thrown when hero dies
      MonstersDiedException - thrown when all monsters are killed
      FinishGameException - thrown when user chooses to leave the game

    • monsterRound

      private void monsterRound() throws MonstersDiedException, HeroDiedException
      Execute monsters functions
      Throws:
      MonstersDiedException - thrown when all monsters are killed
      HeroDiedException - thrown when hero is killed

    • configure

      private void configure() throws CannotWalkOverException, PositionDoesNotExistException, IsTrapException
      Sets whether the map is standard or random. Configures hero starting position.
      Throws:
      CannotWalkOverException - thrown when selected hero starting position is occupied by scenery object that cannot be traversed
      PositionDoesNotExistException - thrown when selected hero starting position does not exist
      IsTrapException - thrown when selected hero starting position is already occupied by a trap

    • selectMapMode

      private MapMode selectMapMode()
      Lets the user select the map mode (default or random)
      Returns:
      map mode type

    • selectHero

      private Hero selectHero​(int[] startPosition)
      Lets the user select the hero type
      Parameters:
      startPosition - column and row where hero is placed at the start
      Returns:
      hero reference

    • drawBoard

      private void drawBoard()
      Draws game map on screen

    • heroMovement

      private void heroMovement() throws HeroDiedException, FinishGameException
      Executes hero movement phase
      Throws:
      HeroDiedException - thrown when hero is killed
      FinishGameException - thrown when user chooses to end the game

    • collectItem

      private void collectItem()
      Hero's item collection phase

      private void changeHeroEquipment()
      Hero's equipment change phase

    • changeHeroSpell

      private void changeHeroSpell()
      Phase for changing hero's equipped spell

    • heroAction

      private void heroAction() throws MonstersDiedException
      Hero's action phase, where the user chooses to attack, cast a spell or collect an item
      Throws:
      MonstersDiedException - thrown when all monsters are killed

    • heroAttack

      private void heroAttack()
      Hero's attack routine: select a target and execute the equipped weapon's attack

    • physicalCombat

      private void physicalCombat​(Character attacker, Character defender)
      Execute combat between two characters
      Parameters:
      attacker - character that will roll attack dices and deal damage
      defender - character that will roll defense dices and possibly receive damage

    • afterActionReport

      private void afterActionReport​(Character attacker, Character defender)
      Display report after combat
      Parameters:
      attacker - character that dealt damage
      defender - character that received damage

    • heroSpell

      private void heroSpell() throws NoSpellLeftException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Hero's spell casting routine
      Throws:
      NoSpellLeftException - thrown when hero has no more spells to cast, either in hand or in bag
      java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown when hero has not equipped any spells and tries to cast one

    • usePotion

      private void usePotion()
      Hero's potion usage routine

    • selectTargetPosition

      private int[] selectTargetPosition()
      Set target position for spell usage that requires a (x, y) destination
      Returns:
      column and row value inputted by user

    • monsterAttack

      private void monsterAttack() throws HeroDiedException
      Monters' attack routine
      Throws:
      HeroDiedException - thrown when the hero is killed

    • selectTarget

      private java.util.ArrayList<Monster> selectTarget​(int range, int maxTargets) throws NoAvailableMonstersToAttackException
      Target character selection for spell usage that requires a character or more as targets
      Parameters:
      range - current attack range, given by spell equipped
      maxTargets - number of targets selected
      Returns:
      array of monster targets selected
      Throws:
      NoAvailableMonstersToAttackException - thrown when there are no monster available to attack

    • monsterMovement

      private void monsterMovement()
      Monster's movement routine
